abstract.para: Comparison of YOY grayling growth in fertilized and unfertilized reaches of the Kuparuk river, June-August 1990.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The Kuparuk River. Control zone, -0.1 to -1.2K; Fertilized zone, 2.0 to 2.6K.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: 29Nov90 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Julie Pallant DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME:Julie Pallant DATE: 7Oct91

para.literalLayout: The response of fish to fertilization was determined by collecting larval grayling from control and fertilized river reaches. Approximately every ten days, larvae were collected from each section using dip nets. They were taken to the field laboratory for length (SL in mm) and wet weight (g) measurements. All larvae not killed when captured were held until their guts were cleared before being weighing. At the end of the season, YOY were collected from three sites in each zone.
Notes: Both standard (SL) and total (TL) lengths were taken this year, as both have been taken in previous years and a conversion factor was needed to compare these data.
Reference Citations: (16) FORMAT OF VARIABLES; FILENAME: 90DEKYOY.WK1
